captions.text:
The following trailer is rated "S" for super
spoilers.

the visionary director behind "Legend of the
Guardians: The Owls of Ga'Hoole"
Comes the world's most hopeful superhero

in his inevitable dark, moody Christopher
Nolan update

Because God forbid a Superman movie be any
damn fun for anybody.
Prepare for a mopey, violent reboot

guaranteed to depress adults and frighten
small children.
where one of America's greatest icons, Superman,
with the acting range of a crumpet.
But my god, what a beefcake.

He's the hero who stood for truth, justice,
and the American way,

Journey to Superman's birthplace of Pandora,
err... Krypton,

Meet General Zod, a Kryptonian out to destroy
humanity

Superman must decide which of his two Robin
Hood dads to listen to.

Space Dad says show off your powers to inspire
humanity.
"You could be the bridge between two peoples."

Farm Dad says hide your powers and let innocent
people die.

"What was I supposed to do? Just let them
die?"

Watch Superman honor them both, as he shows
off his powers AND lets innocent people
Meet Lois Lane, a Pulitzer Prize winning reporter.
"I am a Pulitzer Prize winning reporter!"
She's a superhero in her own right,

with the powers of staying alive in sub-freezing
temperatures,

and showing up wherever the plot needs her
to be.

"General Zod would like THIS WOMAN to accompany
me."

C'mon, there is no reason she should be on
that military plane.
"It's supposed to go in all the way!"
When Lois uses her Nikon camera
to photograph this Budweiser drinking alien,

she'll discover the truth from his friend
at the IHOP.

But when Zod sends a message on this Nokia
phone

it's up to Superman to take him on with this
U-Haul truck

So, if you loved the Christopher Reeve era
Superman movies,
but wished they made them less hopeful,
visualized our worst fears of urban terrorism,

and had Superman overcome his first villain
by murdering him with his
DC has made the reboot for you, psycho!
and those pin art desk toy things.
the one's you used to press your face against.
You guys know what I'm talking about, right?

Can't believe I'm now actually rooting for
Ben Affleck to kick this guys ass.
"I'm going to steal the Declaration of Independence."
"The jerk store called and they rant out of YOU."
"The fox says what I say it says."
"I am vengence, I am the night, I am Batman."

Hey Screen Junkies, for more awesome stuff,
click here to subscribe!

comments.author: assixofficial

comments.text:
Why does everyone bitch about Superman killing someone? Even in the early 
comics, Batman used a gun and sometimes killed IIRC. This whole 
"superheroes should *NEVER* kill" bullshit sends a bad message to kids. 
That no matter what, one can show mercy and that will make things better 
for both sides. Mercy is how we let ISIS get so bad. While we should always 
try to be merciful with our adversaries, after a certain point, there 
should be no mercy.


Superman killing Zod was the most respectable response. Someone with his 
zeal would never stop, so the only two choices would be to kill him or let 
him get his way. And no-one wanted the latter option.﻿

comments.author: mitchaspinell

comments.text:
Neck beards on here are nerd-raging with their faces turning red—like Nick 
Mundy's—whilst completely forgetting that in Superman 2, Clark turned Zod, 
Non, and Ursa human before throwing them down a chasm to their death, 
smiling cheerfully as he did it. So if you're gonna complain about Man of 
Steel getting the comics totally and completely wrong because of the fact 
he killed Zod, then you seriously need to also consider the flaws of your 
so-called "way better" 70s & 80s adaptions. Oh, Superman also kills The 
Joker in the comics. Just saying.﻿

comments.author: dema ziza

comments.text:
Superman is an inherently optimistic character. Superman's always been the 
everyman people's champion who can do anything and right any wrong while 
never stooping to the bad guys' level.  Superman is the ultimate 
aspirational hero we wish we could have and could be.  Christopher 
Reeve understood this and this is why all of these other versions fall 
short every time.﻿
comments.author: ThePitt1973

comments.text:
+ThePitt1973 I never really liked Christopher Reeve's Superman because he 
always felt like a super powered police officer telling every one what to 
do and what not to do; Saving people because he is supposed to. Henry 
Cavill's felt like a person trying to do the right thing; Like a man 
running in a burning building to save someone because their life is worth 
more then his own. For that reason alone I think man of steel in bodies 
Superman more.
